title: Check Palindrome
description: Determine if a string reads the same forwards and backwards
instructions:
Write a function `isPalindrome(str)` that checks if a string is a palindrome (reads the same forwards and backwards). Ignore spaces and be case-insensitive.

Example: isPalindrome('racecar') should return true
Example: isPalindrome('hello') should return false

hints.content: First, convert the string to lowercase and remove spaces. Then compare characters from both ends moving toward the middle.
Use .toLowerCase() and .replace(/ /g, '') to clean the string. Then compare the first character with the last, second with second-to-last, etc. You only need to check half the string.

Clean: `const cleaned = str.toLowerCase().replace(/ /g, '');`. Loop to middle: `for (let i = 0; i < cleaned.length / 2; i++)`. Compare: `if (cleaned[i] !== cleaned[cleaned.length - 1 - i]) return false;`
